title: Frontend updates: permanent master admin code UX + admin settings copy

requirements.summary: On /admin-access, treat 7583A (case/whitespace normalized) as an immediate success that redirects to /admin without showing access-denied.
acceptanceCriteria: Entering 7583A on /admin-access shows "Access Granted" and navigates to /admin automatically.
No "Access Denied" message is shown when the user enters 7583A (including case/whitespace variants that normalize to 7583A).
Redirect happens automatically after success without requiring additional user interaction.

file_operations.description: Update admin access submission and UI gating so normalized input (trim + uppercase) equal to "7583A" short-circuits all lockout/denied paths: immediately set success UI state (showing exactly "Access Granted"), call setAdminAccessUnlocked(), and auto-navigate to "/admin". Ensure the lockout UI does not prevent entering the code (e.g., do not fully replace the form with a lockout-only screen), while keeping existing lockout behavior for all non-master codes.

requirements.summary: Revise admin settings UI text to clearly state 7583A is a permanent master code and the editable form only changes a configurable secondary code.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin access code settings section labeling/descriptions clearly state that "7583A" is permanent and cannot be changed.
The update form is described as changing a configurable/secondary admin access code (while 7583A always remains valid).
All user-facing text remains in English.

file_operations.description: Update headings/descriptions/labels/button text and any success/error copy so the page explicitly states "7583A" is the permanent master admin code (cannot be changed) and the form updates only the configurable/secondary admin access code used for normal access. Ensure all user-facing text remains English and no copy implies 7583A is editable.

Update Security Settings copy (card title/description, labels, and toast messages where applicable) to present "7583A" as the permanent master admin code that cannot be changed, and clarify the form changes only the configurable/secondary admin access code while 7583A always remains valid. Keep all user-facing text in English.
